page.title: 15Pendomer & Halstock-Churches
page.content: Pendomer Church, with its squat tower and fine hilltop situation, is dedicated to St Roch, celebrated for his devotion to healing. This is believed to have been a re-dedication after most of the population was wiped out by the plague. In the beautifully kept perpendicular church is the fourteenth century tomb of Sir John de Domer. The parish shares a rector with Hardington, East Coker and East Chinnock, in the diocese of Bath and Wells, but has regular and well attended services. Pendomer has two former rectories - the older is now Parsonage Farm, and its Victorian successor, outside the block, is a private dwelling. Halstock's parish church is St Mary, and it is served by the Melbury team ministry, along with several other villages in this part of Salisbury diocese.
